column4: I keep seeing references to an [ Add ]  button in network-admin, but I have no such button.
I'm having _major_ issues trying to add a wireless nic
I've tried adding it to /etc/network/interfaces
>> http://www.ubuntulinux.org/wiki/HardwareSupportComponentsWirelessNetworkCards/
I know it is supported (atheros chipset).  I just don't know how to add an interface in a Debian-based distro
sudo network-admin
that doesn't help either.  There is no way to add an interface.  Just change the one that are there.
what ?
That is what I thought.  It doesn't sound right.
but afaict I am up to date
there used to be on there wtf ?
that's useless :D
Tell me about it :-/
Is there instructions on adding an interface manually?
well if you know the module name just modprobe the network card driver and hope it shows up in network-admin I guess at this point :(
Nope. :-/  I already did that, and it still doesn't show up...
<sigh>
thx for the help though
well gl dude I am haveing a few beer atm adn not that much help :)
np, dude.  I have a few beers to console me while I figure this out. ;-)
:D
